member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.Accessors
member.summary: The various DOM object accessor types.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Attributes.Accessors.None
member.summary: Specifies that the property does not have any special meaning.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Attributes.Accessors.Getter
member.summary: Specifies that the property or method should be handled as a getter.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Attributes.Accessors.Setter
member.summary: Specifies that the property or method should be handled as a setter.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Attributes.Accessors.Deleter
member.summary: Specifies that the property or method should be handled by delete.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomAccessorAttribute
member.summary: This attribute decorates official DOM objects as specified by the W3C. You could use it to check if the given property or method should be placed on special locations, e.g. as a getter, setter or handled by a delete call.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomAccessorAttribute.Type
member.summary: Gets the accessor types for the given property or method.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomConstructorAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to mark a constructor as being accessible from scripts.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomDescriptionAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is used to place a description on some object. The description can then be read out at runtime.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomDescriptionAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets the official name of the given class, method or property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomLenientThisAttribute
member.summary: The attribute indicates that invocations of the attribute's getter or setter with a this value that is not an object that implements the interface on which the attribute appears will be ignored.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomNoInterfaceObjectAttribute
member.summary: This attribute appears on an interfaces, which must not be available in the ECMAScript binding.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomPutForwardsAttribute
member.summary: Decorates a read only attribute declaration whose type is an interface type. It indicates that assigning to the attribute will have specific behavior. Namely, the assignment is "forwarded" to the named attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomPutForwardsAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets the official name of the property to forward assignments to.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomHistoricalAttribute
member.summary: This attribute decorates official DOM objects that should no longer be used and are therefore considered deprecated.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomNameAttribute
member.summary: This attribute decorates official DOM objects as specified by the W3C. You could use it to detect all DOM types or get the correct spelling (PascalCase to camelCase). Multiple usages are allowed and should be checked.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Attributes.DomNameAttribute.OfficialName
member.summary: Gets the official name of the given class, method or property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Configuration
member.summary: Represents context configuration for the AngleSharp library. Custom configurations can be made by deriving from this class, just implementing IConfiguration or modifying an instance of this specific class. To change the default configuration one needs to provide a service that implements IConfiguration in the dependency resolver.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Configuration.defaultConfiguration
member.summary: A fixed configuration that cannot be changed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Configuration.customConfiguration
member.summary: A custom configuration that is user-defined.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new default configuration.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.Services
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the registered services.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.ScriptEngines
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the available script engines. By default no script engine is integrated.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.StyleEngines
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the available style engines, besides the default CSS engine.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.Requesters
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over all available (e.g. http) requesters.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.Default
member.summary: Gets the default configuration to use. The default configuration can be overriden by placing some configuration in the DependencyResolver.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.IsScripting
member.summary: Gets or sets the current scripting mode. Default is false.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.IsStyling
member.summary: Gets or sets the current CSS mode. Default is true.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.IsEmbedded
member.summary: Gets or sets the current embedding mode. Normally the document is NOT embedded. Enabling embedding will emulate the document being rendered in an iframe. Default is false.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Configuration.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture to use. Default is the system (UI) culture.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.ReportError(AngleSharp.Parser.ParseErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Reports an error by writing to the debug console.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.SetDefault(AngleSharp.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Sets the default configuration to use, when the configuration is omitted.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Register(AngleSharp.Services.IService)
member.summary: Adds the provided service.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Register(AngleSharp.Dom.IScriptEngine)
member.summary: Adds the given script engine.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Register(AngleSharp.Network.IRequester)
member.summary: Adds the given requester.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Register(AngleSharp.Dom.IStyleEngine)
member.summary: Adds the given styling engine.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Unregister(AngleSharp.Dom.IScriptEngine)
member.summary: Removes the given script engine.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Unregister(AngleSharp.Dom.IStyleEngine)
member.summary: Removes the given style engine.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Unregister(AngleSharp.Services.IService)
member.summary: Removes the given service.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Configuration.Unregister(AngleSharp.Network.IRequester)
member.summary: Removes the given requester.
member.returns: The current instance for chaining.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Converters
member.summary: A set of already constructed CSS value converters.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.LineWidthConverter
member.summary: Represents a length object with line-width additions. http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-backgrounds/#line-width

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.LineHeightConverter
member.summary: Represents a distance object with line-height additions. http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-line-height

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.BorderSliceConverter
member.summary: Represents a length object that is based on percentage or number. http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-backgrounds/#border-image-slice

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.ImageBorderWidthConverter
member.summary: Represents a length object that is based on percentage, length or number. http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-backgrounds/#border-image-width

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.LengthConverter
member.summary: Represents a length object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.ResolutionConverter
member.summary: Represents a resolution object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/resolution

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.FrequencyConverter
member.summary: Represents a frequency object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/frequency

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.TimeConverter
member.summary: Represents a time object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/time

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.UrlConverter
member.summary: Represents an URL object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/uri

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.StringConverter
member.summary: Represents a string object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/string

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.IdentifierConverter
member.summary: Represents an identifier object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/user-ident

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.AnimatableConverter
member.summary: Represents an identifier object that matches the production rules of a single transition property. http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-transitions/#single-transition-property

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.IntegerConverter
member.summary: Represents an integer object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/integer

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.PositiveIntegerConverter
member.summary: Represents an integer object that is zero or greater. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/integer

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Converters.AngleConverter
member.summary: Represents an angle object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/angle

member.summary: Represents a number object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/number

member.summary: Represents a percentage object. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/percentage

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Priority
member.summary: A priority object for comparing priorities.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Zero
member.summary: Gets the lowest (zero) priority.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.OneTag
member.summary: Gets the priority for having a single tag.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.OneClass
member.summary: Gets the priority for having a single class.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.OneId
member.summary: Gets the priority for having a single Id.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Inline
member.summary: Gets the priority for having an inline element.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new priority with the given hashcode.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a new priority with the given values.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Tags
member.summary: Gets the number of tags for this priority.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Classes
member.summary: Gets the number of classes for this priority.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Ids
member.summary: Gets the number of ids for this priority.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Inlines
member.summary: Gets the number of inlines for this priority.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_Addition(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Adds the two given priorities.
member.returns: The result of adding the two priorities.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_Equality(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the two do match.
member.returns: True if both priorities are equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_GreaterThan(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the first one is greater.
member.returns: True if the first priority is higher, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the first one is greater or equal.
member.returns: True if the first priority is higher or equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_LessThan(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the second one is greater.
member.returns: True if the second priority is higher, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_LessThanOrEqual(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the second one is greater or equal.
member.returns: True if the second priority is higher or equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.op_Inequality(AngleSharp.Css.Priority,AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares two priorities and returns a boolean indicating if the two do not match.
member.returns: True if both priorities are not equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Equals(AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Checks two priorities for equality.
member.returns: True if both priorities or equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Tests if another object is equal to this object.
member.returns: True if the two objects are equal, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code that defines the current priority.
member.returns: The integer value of the hashcode.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.CompareTo(AngleSharp.Css.Priority)
member.summary: Compares the current priority with another priority.
member.returns: A value greater than 1 if the current priority is larger.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Priority.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representing the priority.
member.returns: The string representation.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes
member.summary: Setting used to restrict the abilities that potentially untrusted resources have.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.None
member.summary: No flag is set, everything is accepted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Navigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating browsing contexts other than the sandboxed browsing context itself (or browsing contexts further nested inside it), auxiliary browsing contexts (which are protected by the sandboxed auxiliary navigation browsing context flag defined next), and the top-level browsing context (which is protected by the sandboxed top-level navigation browsing context flag defined below).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.AuxiliaryNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from creating new auxiliary browsing contexts, e.g. using the target attribute, or the window.open() method.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.TopLevelNavigation
member.summary: This flag prevents content from navigating their top-level browsing context and prevents content from closing their top-level browsing context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Plugins
member.summary: This flag prevents content from instantiating plugins, whether using the embed element, the object element, the applet element, or through navigation of a nested browsing context, unless those plugins can be secured.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Origin
member.summary: This flag forces content into a unique origin, thus preventing it from accessing other content from the same origin.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Forms
member.summary: This flag blocks form submission.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.PointerLock
member.summary: This flag disables the Pointer Lock API.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Scripts
member.summary: This flag blocks script execution.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.AutomaticFeatures
member.summary: This flag blocks features that trigger automatically, such as automatically playing a video or automatically focusing a form control.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.Fullscreen
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the requestFullscreen() method.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Sandboxes.DocumentDomain
member.summary: This flag prevents content from using the document.domain feature to change the effective script origin.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible blend-mode values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Indicates that no blending will happen: the selected color is the one of the image on the top, and not the one of the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Indicates that the blended color is the multiplication of the front color and the one of the background. Multiplication of colors always result in a color as dark as the original ones. To the limit, multiplying with black results in black, and multiplying with white results in the other original color.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Simulates the simultaneous projection of the two images on a screen: the resulting color is always as light as the original ones. To the limit, multiplying with black results in the other original color, and multiplying with white results in white.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Acts as multiply or screen depending of the color of the background image for a given pixel. This is similar to hard-light but with the top and bottom color swapped.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects, for each pixel, the darkest color of the backdrop or the front image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects, for each pixel, the lightest color of the backdrop or the front image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Lightens the backdrop according to the value of the foreground color: the brighter it is, the more its color affects the backdrop. White on the foreground image leads to white.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop according to the value of the foreground color: the darker it is, the more its color affects the backdrop. Black on the foreground image leads to black.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Acts as multiply or screen depending of the color of the foreground image for a given pixel. It reproduces an effect next to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop. This is similar to overlay but with the top and bottom color swapped.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Similar to hard-light and darkens or lightens the colors, depending of the foreground color. It leads to an effect next to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Substracts the darker color to the lighter one. Black on the foreground has therefore no effect, white leads to the color of the backdrop, inverted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Similar to difference but produce a result with less contrast. Like for difference, black on the foreground has no effect, while white leads to the color of the backdrop, inverted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Keeps the hue of the foreground color, while using the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Keeps the saturation of the foreground color, while using the hue and luminosity of the backdrop. A backdrop with no saturation, that is a pure grey, will lead to no change to the foreground image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Keeps the saturation and hue of the foreground color, while using the luminosity of the backdrop. This preserves gray levels and can be used to colorize the foreground image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Keeps the luminosity of the foreground color, while using the saturation and hue of the backdrop.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.HoverAbility
member.summary: Specifies a user's ability to hover over elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.HoverAbility.None
member.summary: Elements cannot be hovered at all.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.HoverAbility.OnDemand
member.summary: Possible, but requires a significant action on the user's part.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.HoverAbility.Hover
member.summary: Hover over parts of the page is easily possible.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible object fitting values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting.None
member.summary: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box: determine the object's concrete object size using the default sizing algorithm with no specified size, and a default object size equal to the replaced element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting.Fill
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting.Contain
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting.Cover
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ObjectFitting.ScaleDown
member.summary: Size the content as if none or contain were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.OverflowMode
member.summary: An enumeration with possible overflow modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.OverflowMode.Auto
member.summary: The overflow-mode is determined by the renderer.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.OverflowMode.Visible
member.summary: The content is allowed to overflow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.OverflowMode.Hidden
member.summary: The content is cut to prevent overflowing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.OverflowMode.Scroll
member.summary: The content can be scrolled.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PointerAccuracy
member.summary: Values for the accuracy of a pointer device.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PointerAccuracy.None
member.summary: Not actually a pointing device.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PointerAccuracy.Coarse
member.summary: Defines a pointing device of limited accuracy.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PointerAccuracy.Fine
member.summary: Defines an accurate pointing device.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode
member.summary: An enumeration with possible position modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode.Static
member.summary: The position is determined by the renderer.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode.Relative
member.summary: The position is relative to its determined one.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode.Absolute
member.summary: The position is relative to the upper drawing context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode.Fixed
member.summary: The position is relative to the top drawing context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PositionMode.Sticky
member.summary: The position is either fixed or static depending on the viewport.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ScriptingState
member.summary: Enumeration to describe the current scripting state.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ScriptingState.None
member.summary: Scripts will not run for this document; either it doesn't support a scripting language, or the support isn't active for the current document.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ScriptingState.InitialOnly
member.summary: Scripting is enabled during the initial page load, but is not supported afterwards, e.g., printed pages.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ScriptingState.Enabled
member.summary: Scripting of the page is supported in general and is active for the current document.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UpdateFrequency
member.summary: Available device update frequencies.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UpdateFrequency.None
member.summary: Once it has been rendered, the layout can no longer be updated. Example: documents printed on paper.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UpdateFrequency.Slow
member.summary: The layout may change dynamically according to the usual rules of CSS, but the output device is not able to render or display changes quickly enough for them to be percieved as a smooth animation. Example: E-ink screens or severely under-powered devices.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UpdateFrequency.Normal
member.summary: The layout may change dynamically according to the usual rules of CSS, and the output device is not unusually constrained in speed, so regularly-updating things like CSS Animations can be used. Example: computer screens.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationDirection
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible animation direction values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationDirection.Normal
member.summary: The animation should play forward each cycle. In other words, each time the animation cycles, the animation will reset to the beginning state and start over again. This is the default animation direction setting.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationDirection.Alternate
member.summary: The animation should reverse direction each cycle. When playing in reverse, the animation steps are performed backward. In addition, timing functions are also reversed; for example, an ease-in animation is replaced with an ease-out animation when played in reverse. The count to determine if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationDirection.Reverse
member.summary: The animation plays backward each cycle. Each time the animation cycles, the animation resets to the end state and start over again.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationDirection.AlternateReverse
member.summary: The animation plays backward on the first play-through, then forward on the next, then continues to alternate. The count to determinate if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationFillStyle
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible fill-mode values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationFillStyle.None
member.summary: The animation will not apply any styles to the target before or after it is executing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationFillStyle.Forwards
member.summary: The target will retain the computed values set by the last keyframe encountered during execution. The last keyframe encountered depends on the direction and the number of iterations.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationFillStyle.Backwards
member.summary: The animation will apply the values defined in the first relevant keyframe as soon as it is applied to the target, and retain this during the delayed period. The first relevant keyframe depends of the value of the direction.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.AnimationFillStyle.Both
member.summary: The animation will follow the rules for both forwards and backwards, thus extending the animation properties in both directions.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundAttachment
member.summary: An enumeration with all background attachment settings.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundAttachment.Fixed
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the viewport. Even if an element has a scrolling mechanism, a ‘fixed’ background doesn't move with the element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundAttachment.Local
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents, and the background painting area and background positioning area are relative to the scrollable area of the element rather than to the border framing them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundAttachment.Scroll
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BorderRepeat
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible border repeat values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BorderRepeat.Stretch
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be stretched to fill the gap between the two borders.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BorderRepeat.Repeat
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be repeated until it fills the gap between the two borders.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BorderRepeat.Round
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be repeated until it fills the gap between the two borders. If the image doesn't fit after being repeated an integral number of times, the image is rescaled to fit.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible break modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Auto
member.summary: Initial value. Allows, meaning neither forbid nor force, any break (either page, column or region) to be be inserted before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Always
member.summary: Always force page breaks before (after) the principle box. This is a synonym of page, it has been kept to facilitate transition from page-break-before which is subset of this property.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Avoid
member.summary: Prevent any break, either page, column or region, to be inserted right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Left
member.summary: Force one or two page breaks right before (after) the principle box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Right
member.summary: Force one or two page breaks right before (after) the principle box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Page
member.summary: Always force one page break right before (after) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.Column
member.summary: Always force one column break right before (after) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.AvoidPage
member.summary: Avoid any page break right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.AvoidColumn
member.summary: Avoid any column break right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BreakMode.AvoidRegion
member.summary: Avoid a region break before (after, inside) the generated box.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BoxModel
member.summary: An enumeration with the various box sizing models / clip or origins.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BoxModel.BorderBox
member.summary: The background extends to the outside edge of the border (but underneath the border in z-ordering).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BoxModel.PaddingBox
member.summary: No background is drawn below the border (background extends to the outside edge of the padding).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BoxModel.ContentBox
member.summary: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ClearMode
member.summary: The enumeration with all possible clear modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ClearMode.None
member.summary: The element is not moved down to clear past floating elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ClearMode.Left
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past left floats.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ClearMode.Right
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past right floats.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ClearMode.Both
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past both left and right floats.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode
member.summary: A list of all pre-defined display settings.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.None
F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The element generates one or more inline element boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.Block
member.summary: The element generates a block element box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.ListItem
member.summary: The element generates a block box for the content and a separate list-item inline box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.InlineBlock
member.summary: The element generates a block element box that will be flowed with surrounding content as if it were a single inline box (behaving much like a replaced element would).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.InlineTable
member.summary: he inline-table value does not have a direct mapping in HTML. It behaves like a table HTML element, but as an inline box, rather than a block-level box. Inside the table box is a block-level context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.Table
member.summary: Behaves like the table HTML element. It defines a block-level box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableCaption
member.summary: Behaves like the caption HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableCell
member.summary: Behaves like the td HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableColumn
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding col HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableColumnGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding colgroup HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableFooterGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding tfoot HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableHeaderGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding thead HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableRow
member.summary: Behaves like the tr HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.TableRowGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding tbody HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.Flex
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.InlineFlex
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.Grid
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.DisplayMode.InlineGrid
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Floating
member.summary: All possible values for taking an element out of its normal flow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Floating.None
member.summary: Indicates that the element must not float.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Floating.Left
member.summary: Indicates that the element must float on the left side of its containing block.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Floating.Right
member.summary: Indicates that the element must float on the right side of its containing block.

member.summary: A listing of all possible pre-defined font-sizes.

member.summary: Smaller than the parent's font size.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.FontSize.Large
member.summary: Absolute large.

member.summary: Larger than the parent's font size.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.FontSize.Big

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.FontSize.Huge
member.summary: Absolute xx-large.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.FontStyle
member.summary: The enumeration with the various font styles.

member.summary: Selects a font that is classified as normal within a font-family.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.FontStyle.Italic
member.summary: Selects a font that is labeled italic, if that is not available, one labeled oblique.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListPosition
member.summary: An enumeration over all list positions.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListPosition.Inside
member.summary: The marker box is the first inline box in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListPosition.Outside
member.summary: The marker box is outside the principal block box.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle
member.summary: An enumeration over possible list styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.None
member.summary: No list style at all.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Disc
member.summary: A filled circle (default value)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Circle
member.summary: A hollow circle

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Square
member.summary: A filled square

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Decimal
member.summary: Han decimal numbers, Beginning with 1.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.DecimalLeadingZero
member.summary: Decimal numbers, Padded by initial zeros, E.g. 01, 02, 03, ... 98, 99

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.LowerRoman
member.summary: Lowercase roman numerals, E.g.i, ii, iii, iv, v, ...

member.summary: Uppercase roman numerals, E.g.I, II, III, IV, V ...

member.summary: Lowercase classical Greek, alpha, beta, gamma…, E.g.α, β, γ ...

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.LowerLatin
member.summary: Lowercase ASCII letters, E.g.a, b, c, ... z

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.UpperLatin
member.summary: Uppercase ASCII letters, E.g.A, B, C, ... Z

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Armenian
member.summary: Traditional Armenian numbering, (ayb/ayp, ben/pen, gim/keem ... )

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ListStyle.Georgian
member.summary: Traditional Georgian numbering, E.g.an, ban, gan, ... he, tan, in…

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible line styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.None
member.summary: No outline (outline-width is 0).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Hidden
member.summary: Same as 'none', except in terms of border conflict resolution for table elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Dotted
member.summary: The outline is a series of dots.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Dashed
member.summary: The outline is a series of short line segments.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Solid
member.summary: The outline is a single line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Double
member.summary: The outline is two single lines. The outline-width is the sum of the two lines and the space between them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Groove
member.summary: The outline looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Ridge
member.summary: The opposite of groove: the outline looks as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Inset
member.summary: The outline makes the box look as though it were embeded in the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.LineStyle.Outset
member.summary: The opposite of inset: the outline makes the box look as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PlayState
member.summary: An enumeration over all various play states.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PlayState.Running
member.summary: The animation is currently playing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.PlayState.Paused
member.summary: The animation is currently paused.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundRepeat
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible repeat values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundRepeat.Repeat
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover the whole background image painting area. The last image may be clipped if the whole thing won't fit in the remaining area.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundRepeat.Space
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover most of the background image painting area, without clipping an image. The remaining non-covered space is spaced out evenly between the images. The first and last images touches the edge of the element. The value of the background-position CSS property is ignored for the concerned direction, except if one single image is greater than the background image painting area, which is the only case where an image can be clipped when the space value is used.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundRepeat.Round
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover most of the background image painting area, without clipping an image. If it doesn't cover exactly the area, the tiles are resized in that direction in order to match it.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.BackgroundRepeat.NoRepeat
member.summary: The image is not repeated (and hence the background image painting area will not necessarily been entirely covered). The position of the non-repeated background image is defined by the background-position CSS property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor
member.summary: A list of all pre-defined system cursor modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determined.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Default
member.summary: Default cursor, typically an arrow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.None
member.summary: No cursor is rendered.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.ContextMenu
member.summary: A context menu is available under the cursor.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Help
member.summary: Indicating help is available.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Pointer
member.summary: E.g. used when hovering over links, typically a hand.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Progress
member.summary: The program is busy in the background but the user can still interact with the interface (unlike for wait).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Wait
member.summary: The program is busy (sometimes an hourglass or a watch).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Cell
member.summary: Indicating that cells can be selected.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Crosshair
member.summary: Cross cursor, often used to indicate selection in a bitmap.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Text
member.summary: Indicating text can be selected, typically an I-beam.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.VerticalText
member.summary: Indicating that vertical text can be selected, typically a sideways I-beam.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Alias
member.summary: Indicating an alias or shortcut is to be created.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Copy
member.summary: Indicating that something can be copied.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Move
member.summary: The hovered object may be moved.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NoDrop
member.summary: Cursor showing that a drop is not allowed at the current location.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NotAllowed
member.summary: Cursor showing that something cannot be done.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.EResize
member.summary: Moves the right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NResize
member.summary: Moves the top edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NeResize
member.summary: Moves the top right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NwResize
member.summary: Moves the top left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.SResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.SeResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.SwResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.WResize
member.summary: Moves the left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.EwResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Left to right.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NsResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Top to bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NeswResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Right top to left bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.NwseResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Left top to right bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.ColResize
member.summary: The item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.RowResize
member.summary: The item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.AllScroll
member.summary: Cursor showing that something can be scrolled in any direction (panned).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.ZoomIn
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.ZoomOut
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Grab
member.summary: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemCursor.Grabbing
member.summary: Indicates that something can be dragged to be moved.

member.summary: The font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemFont.Icon
member.summary: The font used to label icons.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemFont.Menu
member.summary: The font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemFont.MessageBox
member.summary: The font used in dialog boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemFont.SmallCaption
member.summary: The font used for labeling small controls.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.SystemFont.StatusBar
member.summary: The font used in window status bars.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationLine
member.summary: An enumeration that defines the various line styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationLine.Underline
member.summary: Each line of text is underlined.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationLine.Overline
member.summary: Each line of text has a line above it.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationLine.LineThrough
member.summary: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationLine.Blink
member.summary: The text blinks (alternates between visible and invisible). Conforming user agents may simply not blink the text.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle
member.summary: An enumeration with the various text decoration styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle.Solid
member.summary: Draws a single line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle.Double
member.summary: Draws a double line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle.Dotted
member.summary: Draws a dotted line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle.Dashed
member.summary: Draws a dashed line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextDecorationStyle.Wavy
member.summary: Draws a wavy line.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible text transformations.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform.None
member.summary: Is a keyword preventing the case of all characters to be changed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform.Capitalize
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the first letter of each word to be converted to uppercase. Other characters are unchanged; that is, they retain their original case as written in the element's text.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform.Uppercase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to uppercase.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform.Lowercase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to lowercase.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.TextTransform.FullWidth
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the writing of a character, mainly ideograms and latin scripts inside a square, allowing them to be aligned in the usual East Asian scripts (like Chinese or Japanese).

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode
member.summary: An enumeration with various unicode modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.Normal
member.summary: The element does not offer a additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline elements implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.Embed
member.summary: If the element is inline, this value opens an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. The direction of this embedding level is given by the direction property.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.Isolate
member.summary: This keyword indicates that the element's container directionality should be calculated without considering the content of this element. The element is therefore isolated from its siblings. When applying its bidirectional-resolution algorithm, its container element treats it as one or several U+FFFC Object Replacement Character, i.e. like an image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.BidiOverride
member.summary: For inline elements this creates an override. For block container elements this creates an override for inline-level descendants not within another block container element. This means that inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the direction property; the implicit part of the bidirectional algorithm is ignored.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.IsolateOverride
member.summary: This keyword applies the isolation behavior of the isolate keyword to the surrounding content and the override behavior of the bidi-override keyword to the inner content.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.UnicodeMode.Plaintext
member.summary: This keyword makes the elements directionality calculated without considering its parent bidirectional state or the value of the direction property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace
member.summary: An enumeration with the various whitespace handling modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace.Normal
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Newline characters in the source are handled as other whitespace. Breaks lines as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace.Pre
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved, lines are only broken at newline characters in the source and at br elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace.NoWrap
member.summary: Collapses whitespace as for normal, but suppresses line breaks (text wrapping) within text.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace.PreWrap
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved. Lines are broken at newline characters, at br, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.Whitespace.PreLine
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Lines are broken at newline characters, at br, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssBorderImageWidthProperty.WidthTop
member.summary: Gets the top length of the image slice. It can be an absolute or relative length. This length must not be negative. If a percentage of the image slice is given it is relative to the height of the border image area. The percentage must not be negative.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssBorderImageWidthProperty.WidthBottom
member.summary: Gets the bottom length of the image slice. It can be an absolute or relative length. This length must not be negative. If a percentage of the image slice is given it is relative to the height of the border image area. The percentage must not be negative.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssBorderImageWidthProperty.WidthLeft
member.summary: Gets the left length of the image slice. It can be an absolute or relative length. This length must not be negative. If a percentage of the image slice is given it is relative to the width of the border image area. The percentage must not be negative.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssBorderImageWidthProperty.WidthRight
member.summary: Gets the right length of the image slice. It can be an absolute or relative length. This length must not be negative. If a percentage of the image slice is given it is relative to the width of the border image area. The percentage must not be negative.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssFontFamilyProperty.SystemFonts.Serif
member.summary: Glyphs have finishing strokes, flared or tapering ends, or have actual serifed endings. E.g. Palatino, "Palatino Linotype", Palladio, "URW Palladio", serif

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssFontFamilyProperty.SystemFonts.SansSerif
member.summary: Glyphs have stroke endings that are plain. E.g. 'Trebuchet MS', 'Liberation Sans', 'Nimbus Sans L', sans-serif

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssFontFamilyProperty.SystemFonts.Monospace
member.summary: All glyphs have the same fixed width. E.g. "DejaVu Sans Mono", Menlo, Consolas, "Liberation Mono", Monaco, "Lucida Console", monospace

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssFontFamilyProperty.SystemFonts.Cursive
member.summary: Glyphs in cursive fonts generally have either joining strokes or other cursive characteristics beyond those of italic typefaces. The glyphs are partially or completely connected, and the result looks more like handwritten pen or brush writing than printed letterwork.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.CssFontFamilyProperty.SystemFonts.Fantasy
member.summary: Fantasy fonts are primarily decorative fonts that contain playful representations of characters.

Values may be negative, but there may be implementation-specific limits. User agents may not further increase or decrease the inter-character space in order to justify text.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ICssFontWeightProperty.Weight
member.summary: Numeric font weights for fonts that provide more than just normal and bold. If the exact weight given is unavailable, then 600-900 use the closest available darker weight (or, if there is none, the closest available lighter weight), and 100-500 use the closest available lighter weight (or, if there is none, the closest available darker weight). This means that for fonts that provide only normal and bold, 100-500 are normal, and 600-900 are bold.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ICssFontWeightProperty.IsRelative
member.summary: Gets if the given value should be considered relative to the current one.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ICssLineHeightProperty.Height
member.summary: Gets the specified length that is used in the calculation of the line box height. Could also be relative to the font size of the element itself. The computed value is this percentage multiplied by the element's computed font size.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Css.ICssGroupingRule.Insert(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to insert a new rule into the media block.
member.param: The parsable text representing the rule. For rule sets this contains both the selector and the style declaration. For at-rules, this specifies both the at-identifier and the rule content.
The index within the media block's rule collection of the rule before which to insert the specified rule.
member.returns: The index within the media block's rule collection of the newly inserted rule.

member.summary: Used to delete a rule from the media block.

member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern HTML attribute, containing a regular expression that the control's value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.Step
member.summary: Gets or sets the step HTML attribute, which works with min and max to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.StepUp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Increments the value by (step * n), where n defaults to 1 if not specified.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.List
member.summary: Gets the datalist element in the same document. Only options that are valid values for this input element will be displayed. This attribute is ignored when the type attribute's value is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.FormAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the URI of a resource that processes information submitted by the button. If specified, this attribute overrides the action attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.FormEncType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of content that is used to submit the form to the server. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.FormMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP method that the browser uses to submit the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the method attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.FormNoValidate
member.summary: Gets or sets that the form is not to be validated when it is submitted. If specified, this attribute overrides the enctype attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.FormTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets A name or keyword indicating where to display the response that is received after submitting the form. If specified, this attribute overrides the target attribute of the form element that owns this element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.SelectionDirection
member.summary: Gets the direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.DirectionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the directionality of the form element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the beginning of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the first argument, and selectionEnd as the second argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the end of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the second argument, and selectionStart as the first argument.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects the contents of the textarea.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlInputElement.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text, and sets selectionStart and selectionEnd. If either argument is greater than the length of the value, it is treated as pointing to the end of the value. If end is less than start, then both are treated as the value of end.
member.param: Optional: The direction of the selection.

member.summary: Gets the assigned table rows.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableElement.InsertRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new empty row in the table. The new row is inserted immediately before and in the same section as the current indexth row in the table. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows, the new row is appended. In addition, when the table is empty the row is inserted into a TBODY which is created and inserted into the table.
member.param: The row number where to insert a new row. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table.
member.returns: The inserted table row.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableElement.RemoveRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a table row.
member.param: The index of the row to be deleted. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table. If the index is -1 the last row in the table is deleted.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableElement.Border
member.summary: Gets or sets the border attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableRowElement.Cells
member.summary: Gets the assigned table cells.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableRowElement.InsertCellAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Insert an empty TD cell into this row. If index is -1 or equal to the number of cells, the new cell is appended.
member.param: [Optional] The place to insert the cell, starting from 0. A negative value indicates that the cell should be appended to the row.
member.returns: The inserted table cell.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableRowElement.RemoveCellAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a cell from the current row.
member.param: The index of the cell to delete, starting from 0. If the index is -1 the last cell in the row is deleted.
member.returns: The current row.

member.summary: Gets the assigned table rows.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableSectionElement.InsertRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a row into this section. The new row is inserted immediately before the current indexth row in this section. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows in this section, the new row is appended.
member.param: The row number where to insert a new row. This index starts from 0 and is relative only to the rows contained inside this section, not all the rows in the table.
member.returns: The inserted table row.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTableSectionElement.RemoveRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a row from this section.
member.param: The index of the row to be deleted, or -1 to delete the last row. This index starts from 0 and is relative only to the rows contained inside this section, not all the rows in the table.

member.summary: Gets the direction in which selection occurred. This is "forward" if selection was performed in the start-to-end direction of the current locale, or "backward" for the opposite direction.

member.summary: Gets or sets the directionality of the form element.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the beginning of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the first argument, and selectionEnd as the second argument.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the end of selected text. If no text is selected, contains the index of the character that follows the input cursor. On being set, the control behaves as if setSelectionRange() had been called with this as the second argument, and selectionStart as the first argument.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTextAreaElement.SelectAll
member.summary: Selects the contents of the textarea.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IHtmlTextAreaElement.Select(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Selects a range of text, and sets selectionStart and selectionEnd. If either argument is greater than the length of the value, it is treated as pointing to the end of the value. If end is less than start, then both are treated as the value of end.
member.param: Optional: The direction of the selection.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState
member.summary: The ValidityState interface represents the validity states that an element can be in, with respect to constraint validation. Together, they help explain why an element's value fails to validate, if it's not valid.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsValueMissing
member.summary: Gets if the element has a required attribute, but no value.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsTypeMismatch
member.summary: Gets if the value is not in the required syntax (when type is email or url).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsPatternMismatch
member.summary: Gets if the value does not match the specified pattern.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsTooLong
member.summary: Gets if the value exceeds the specified maxlength.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsTooShort
member.summary: Gets if the value is below the specified minlength.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsBadInput
member.summary: Gets if the value is regarded is invalid input.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsRangeUnderflow
member.summary: Gets if the value is less than the minimum specified by the min attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsRangeOverflow
member.summary: Gets if the value is greater than the maximum specified by the max attribute.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsStepMismatch
member.summary: Gets if the value does not fit the rules determined by the step attribute (that is, it's not evenly divisible by the step value).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsCustomError
member.summary: Gets the element's custom validity message.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.IValidityState.IsValid
member.summary: Gets if the element meets all constraint validations, and is therefore considered to be valid.

member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the element.

member.summary: Gets or sets the alt HTML attribute, containing alternative text to use when type is image.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Autocomplete
member.summary: Gets or sets the autocomplete HTML attribute, indicating whether the value of the control can be automatically completed by the browser. Ignored if the value of the type attribute is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type (button, submit, reset, image).

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Files
member.summary: Gets a list of selected files.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.List
member.summary: Gets the datalist element in the same document. Only options that are valid values for this input element will be displayed. This attribute is ignored when the type attribute's value is hidden, checkbox, radio, file, or a button type.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets max HTML attribute, containing the maximum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be less than its minimum (min attribute) value.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the min HTML attribute, containing the minimum (numeric or date-time) value for this item, which must not be greater than its maximum (max attribute) value.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Pattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the pattern HTML attribute, containing a regular expression that the control's value is checked against. The pattern must match the entire value, not just some subset. This attribute applies when the value of the type attribute is text, search, tel, url or email; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size HTML attribute, containing size of the control. This value is in pixels unless the value of type is text or password, in which case, it is an integer number of characters. Applies only when type is set to text, search, tel, url, email, or password; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Source
P:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlInputElement.Step
member.summary: Gets or sets the step HTML attribute, which works with min and max to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set. It can be the string any or a positive floating point number. If this is not set to any, the control accepts only values at multiples of the step value greater than the minimum.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.InsertRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new empty row in the table. The new row is inserted immediately before and in the same section as the current indexth row in the table. If index is -1 or equal to the number of rows, the new row is appended. In addition, when the table is empty the row is inserted into a TBODY which is created and inserted into the table.
member.param: The row number where to insert a new row. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table.
member.returns: The inserted table row.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.RemoveRowAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Deletes a table row.
member.param: The index of the row to be deleted. This index starts from 0 and is relative to the logical order (not document order) of all the rows contained inside the table. If the index is -1 the last row in the table is deleted.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.CreateHead
member.summary: Create a table header row or return an existing one.
member.returns: A new table header element.

member.summary: Creates a new table body and appends it.
member.returns: The created table body.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.DeleteHead
member.summary: Delete the header from the table, if one exists.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.CreateFoot
member.summary: Create a table footer row or return an existing one.
member.returns: A footer element.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.DeleteFoot
member.summary: Delete the footer from the table, if one exists.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.CreateCaption
member.summary: Create a new table caption object or return an existing one.
member.returns: A caption element.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Html.HtmlTableElement.DeleteCaption
member.summary: Delete the table caption, if one exists.

member.summary: Creates a new event target in the DOM.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.DomEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Register an event handler of a specific event type on the Node.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be added.

True indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered listener before being dispatched to any Node beneath it in the DOM tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger a listener designated to use capture.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget.RemoveEventListener(System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.DomEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes an event listener from the Node.
member.param: A string representing the event type being removed.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be removed.
Specifies whether the EventListener being removed was registered as a capturing listener or not.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget.CallEventListener(AngleSharp.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: Calls the listener registered for the given event.
member.param: The event that asks for the listeners.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget.HasEventListener(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the given event type has any listeners registered.
member.returns: True if listeners are registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget.Dispatch(AngleSharp.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: Dispatch an event to this Node.
member.returns: False if at least one of the event handlers, which handled this event called preventDefault(). Otherwise true.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.Visibility
member.summary: An enumeration with the various visibility states.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Visibility.Visible
member.summary: Default value, the box is visible.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Visibility.Hidden
member.summary: The box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Dom.Visibility.Collapse
member.summary: For table rows, columns, column groups, and row groups the row(s) or column(s) are hidden and the space they would have occupied is removed (as if display: none were applied to the column/row of the table). However, the size of other rows and columns is still calculated as though the cells in the collapsed row(s) or column(s) are present. This was designed for fast removal of a row/column from a table without having to recalculate widths and heights for every portion of the table. For XUL elements, the computed size of the element is always zero, regardless of other styles that would normally affect the size, although margins still take effect. For other elements, collapse is treated the same as hidden.

member.summary: Swaps the application's cache.

member.summary: Event triggered after an error occurred.

member.summary: Event triggered after progress.

member.summary: Event triggered after an update is ready to be applied.

member.summary: Event triggered after the cache has been updated.

member.name: E:AngleSharp.Dom.IApplicationCache.Obsolete
member.summary: Event triggered after the cache has been marked obsolete.

member.summary: Returns a NodeList of elements with the given tag name. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: A string representing the name of the elements. The special string "*" represents all elements.
member.returns: A collection of elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: The namespace URI of elements to look for.
Either the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements.
member.returns: A collection of elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IDocument.Import(AngleSharp.Dom.INode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a copy of a node from an external document that can be inserted into the current document.
member.param: The node from another document to be imported.
Optional argument, indicating whether the descendants of the imported node need to be imported.
member.returns: The new node that is imported into the document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IDocument.Adopt(AngleSharp.Dom.INode)
member.summary: Adopts a node from an external document. The node and its subtree is removed from the document it's in (if any), and its ownerDocument is changed to the current document. The node can then be inserted into the current document. The new node's parentNode is null, since it has not yet been inserted into the document tree.
member.param: The node from another document to be adopted.
member.returns: The adopted node that can be used in the current document.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory
member.summary: The History interface allows to manipulate the browser session history, that is the pages visited in the tab or frame that the current page is loaded in.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of elements in the session history, including the currently loaded page.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.State
member.summary: Gets an any value representing the state at the top of the history stack.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.Go(System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads a page from the session history, identified by its relative location to the current page, for example -1 for the previous page or 1 for the next page. When integerDelta is out of bounds (e.g. -1 when there are no previously visited pages in the session history), the method doesn't do anything and doesn't raise an exception. Calling go() without parameters or with a non-integer argument has no effect.
member.param: The number of states to surpass.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.Back
member.summary: Goes to the previous page in session history, the same action as when the user clicks the browser's Back button. Equivalent to history.go(-1).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.Forward
member.summary: Goes to the next page in session history, the same action as when the user clicks the browser's Forward button; this is equivalent to history.go(1).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.PushState(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Pushes the given data onto the session history stack with the specified title and, if provided, URL. The data is treated as opaque by the DOM.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IHistory.ReplaceState(System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates the most recent entry on the history stack to have the specified data, title, and, if provided, URL. The data is treated as opaque by the DOM.

Either the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements.
