member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.DomEventHandler
member.summary: Defines the callback signature for an event.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.IEventTarget
member.summary: EventTarget is a DOM interface implemented by objects that can receive DOM events and have listeners for them.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IEventTarget.AddEventListener(System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.DomEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Register an event handler of a specific event type on the EventTarget.
member.param: A string representing the event type to listen for.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be added.

True indicates that the user wishes to initiate capture. After initiating capture, all events of the specified type will be dispatched to the registered listener before being dispatched to any EventTarget beneath it in the DOM tree. Events which are bubbling upward through the tree will not trigger a listener designated to use capture.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IEventTarget.RemoveEventListener(System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.DomEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes an event listener from the EventTarget.
member.param: A string representing the event type being removed.
The listener parameter indicates the EventListener function to be removed.
Specifies whether the EventListener being removed was registered as a capturing listener or not.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IEventTarget.Dispatch(AngleSharp.Dom.Events.Event)
member.summary: Dispatch an event to this EventTarget.
member.returns: False if at least one of the event handlers, which handled this event called preventDefault(). Otherwise true.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.IHtmlCollection

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IHtmlCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the specific node whose ID or, as a fallback, name matches the string specified by name. Matching by name is only done as a last resort, only in HTML, and only if the referenced element supports the name attribute.
member.param: The id or name to match.
member.returns: Returns null if no node exists by the given name.

member.summary: Loads the resource at the URL provided in parameter.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ILocation.Replace(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces the current resource with the one at the provided URL. The difference from the assign() method is that after using replace() the current page will not be saved in session History, meaning the user won't be able to use the back button to navigate to it.
member.param: The path to the resource that should replace the current resource.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ILocation.Reload

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord
member.summary: MutationRecord defines an interface that will be passed to the observer's callback.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.Target
member.summary: Gets the node the mutation affected, depending on the type. For attributes, it is the Element whose attribute changed. For CharacterData, it is the CharacterData node. For ChildList, it is the node whose children changed.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.Added
member.summary: Gets the nodes added, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.Removed
member.summary: Gets the nodes removed, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.PreviousSibling
member.summary: Gets the previous sibling of the added or removed nodes, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.NextSibling
member.summary: Gets the next sibling of the added or removed nodes, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.AttributeName
member.summary: Gets the local name of the changed attribute, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.AttributeNamespace
member.summary: Gets the namespace of the changed attribute, or null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IMutationRecord.PreviousValue
member.summary: Gets a string depending on the type. For attributes, it is the value of the changed attribute before the change. For characterData, it is the data of the changed node before the change. For childList, it is null.

member.summary: Clones the Node, and optionally, all of its contents. By default, it clones the content of the node.

member.summary: Gets the Document that this node belongs to. If no document is associated with it, returns null.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.INode.Parent
member.summary: Gets a Node that is the parent of this node. If there is no such node, like if this node is the top of the tree or if doesn't participate in a tree, this property returns null.

member.summary: Returns true if other is an inclusive descendant of the context object, and false otherwise (including when other is null).

member.returns: True if the given node is contained within this Node, otherwise false.

member.summary: Gets the style sheet language for this style sheet.

member.summary: Gets the element that associates this style sheet with the document.

member.summary: Gets the parent stylesheet for style sheet languages that support the concept of style sheet inclusion.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IStyleSheet.Media
member.summary: Gets the intended destination media for style information. The media is often specified in the ownerNode. If no media has been specified, the MediaList is empty.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IStyleSheet.IsDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets if the stylesheet is applied to the document. Modifying this attribute may cause a new resolution of style for the document. If the media doesn't apply to the current user agent, the disabled attribute is ignored.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.IText
member.summary: The Text interface represents the textual content of Element or Attr. If an element has no markup within its content, it has a single child implementing Text that contains the element's text. However, if the element contains markup, it is parsed into information items and Text nodes that form its children.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.IText.Split(System.Int32)
member.summary: Breaks the node into two nodes at a specified offset.
member.param: The point where the Node should be split.
member.returns: The freshly created Text element with the rest of the content.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.IText.Text
member.summary: Gets a string containing the text of all Text nodes logically adjacent to this Node, concatenated in document order.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.ITokenList
member.summary: This type represents a set of space-separated tokens.

member.summary: Gets the number of contained tokens.

member.summary: Gets an item in the list by its index.
member.returns: The item at the specified index.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITokenList.Contains(System.String)

member.returns: The result of the search.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITokenList.Add(System.String[])
member.summary: Adds some tokens to the underlying string.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITokenList.Remove(System.String[])
member.summary: Remove some tokens from the underlying string.
member.param: A list of tokens to remove.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITokenList.Toggle(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the specified token from string and returns false. If token doesn't exist it's added and the function returns true.
member.returns: True if the token has been added, otherwise false.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker
member.summary: The TreeWalker object represents the nodes of a document subtree and a position within them.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Root
member.summary: Gets a Node representing the root node as specified when the TreeWalker was created.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets the Node on which the TreeWalker is currently pointing at.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Settings
member.summary: Gets a description of the types of nodes that must to be presented. Non-matching nodes are skipped, but their children may be included, if relevant.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.Filter
member.summary: Gets the NodeFilter used to select the relevant nodes.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToNext
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the next visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.
member.returns: The next Node, if any.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToPrevious
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the previous visible node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists,or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.
member.returns: The previous Node, if any.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToParent
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible ancestor node in the document order, and returns the found node. It also moves the current node to this one. If no such node exists, or if it is before that the root node defined at the object construction, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToFirst
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the first visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToLast
member.summary: Moves the current Node to the last visible child of the current node, and returns the found child. It also moves the current node to this child. If no such child exists, returns null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToPreviousSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its previous sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.ITreeWalker.ToNextSibling
member.summary: Moves the current Node to its next sibling, if any, and returns the found sibling. I there is no such node, return null and the current node is not changed.

member.summary: Registers the MutationObserver instance to receive notifications of DOM mutations on the specified node.

member.returns: Returns an Array of MutationRecords.

member.summary: Provides a number of methods for performing operations that are independent of any particular instance of the DOM.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.DomImplementation.CreateDocumentType(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an empty DocumentType node. Entity declarations and notations are not made available. Entity reference expansions and default attribute additions do not occur.
member.param: The qualified name of the document type to be created.
member.returns: A new DocumentType node with the owner document set to null.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.DomImplementation.CreateDocument(System.String,System.String,AngleSharp.Dom.IDocumentType)
member.summary: Creates a DOM Document object of the specified type with its document element.
member.param: Optional: The namespace URI of the document element to create.
Optional: The qualified name of the document element to be created.
Optional: The type of document to be created.
member.returns: A new Document object with its document element.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.DomImplementation.CreateHtmlDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a DOM HTML Document object of the specified type with its document element.
member.param: The title of the HTML document.
member.returns: A new Document object with its document element.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.DomImplementation.HasFeature(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Test if the DOM implementation implements a specific feature and version, as specified in DOM Features.
member.param: The name of the feature requested. Note that any plus sign "+" prepended to the name of the feature will be ignored since it is not significant in the context of this method.
This is the version number of the feature to test.
member.returns: True if the feature is implemented in the specified version, false otherwise.

member.returns: A collection of elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Element.QuerySelector(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first element within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that matches the specified group of selectors.
member.param: A string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.
member.returns: An element object.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Element.QuerySelectorAll(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of the elements within the document (using depth-first pre-order traversal of the document's nodes) that match the specified group of selectors.
member.param: A string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.
member.returns: A collection of HTML elements.

member.summary: Returns a set of elements which have all the given class names.
member.param: A string representing the list of class names to match; class names are separated by whitespace.
member.returns: A collection of HTML elements.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Element.GetElementsByTagName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a NodeList of elements with the given tag name. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: A string representing the name of the elements. The special string "*" represents all elements.
member.returns: A NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Dom.Element.GetElementsByTagNameNS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: The namespace URI of elements to look for.
Either the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements.
member.returns: A NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.summary: A set of useful extension methods for the Window class.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.WindowExtensions.ComputeCascadedStyle(AngleSharp.Dom.Collections.StyleCollection,AngleSharp.Dom.IElement)
member.summary: Computes the cascaded style, i.e. resolves the cascade by ordering after specifity. Two rules with the same specifity are ordered according to their appearance. The more recent declaration wins. Inheritance is not taken into account.
member.param: The element to compute the cascade for.
member.returns: Returns the cascaded read-only style declaration.

member.summary: Generates the style collection for the given window object.

member.returns: The device-bound style collection.

member.summary: Provides a stable state by running the synchronous sections of asynchronously-running algorithms until the asynchronous algorithm can be resumed (if appropriate).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.DocumentExtensions.HasScriptBlockingStyleSheet(AngleSharp.Dom.Document)
member.summary: Checks if the document has any active stylesheets that block the scripts. A style sheet is blocking scripts if the responsible element was created by that Document's parser, and the element is either a style element or a link element that was an external resource link that contributes to the styling processing model when the element was created by the parser, and the element's style sheet was enabled when the element was created by the parser, and the element's style sheet ready flag is not yet set. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/document-metadata.html#has-no-style-sheet-that-is-blocking-scripts
member.returns: True if any stylesheets still need to be downloaded, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.DocumentExtensions.WaitForReady(AngleSharp.Dom.Document)
member.summary: Spins the event loop until all stylesheets are downloaded (if required) and all scripts are ready to be parser executed. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/syntax.html#the-end (bullet 3)

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.EventTargetExtensions.FireSimpleEvent(AngleSharp.Dom.EventTarget,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Firing a simple event named e means that a trusted event with a name, which does not bubble, is not cancelable and which uses the Event interface. It is created and dispatched at the given target.

The name of the event to be fired.
Optional parameter to make it cancelable.
member.returns: True if the element was cancelled, otherwise false.

member.param: The target, where the event has been invoked.
The current event target, if different to the invoked target.
member.returns: True if the element was cancelled, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.QueryExtensions.QuerySelector(AngleSharp.Dom.INodeList,System.String)

A string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.

member.param: The elements to take as source.
A string containing one or more CSS selectors separated by commas.
member.returns: A HTMLCollection with all elements that match the selection.

member.param: The elements to take as source.
member.returns: A HTMLCollection with all elements that match the selection.

member.summary: Returns a set of elements which have all the given class names.
member.param: The elements to take as source.
A string representing the list of class names to match; class names are separated by whitespace.
member.returns: A collection of HTML elements.

member.summary: Returns a NodeList of elements with the given tag name. The complete document is searched, including the root node.

A string representing the name of the elements. The special string "*" represents all elements.
member.returns: A NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.summary: Returns a list of elements with the given tag name belonging to the given namespace. The complete document is searched, including the root node.
member.param: The elements to take as source.
The namespace URI of elements to look for.
Either the local name of elements to look for or the special value "*", which matches all elements.
member.returns: A NodeList of found elements in the order they appear in the tree.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Extensions.StringExtensions.UrlEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Replaces characters in names and values that should not be in URL values. Replaces the bytes 0x20 (U+0020 SPACE if interpreted as ASCII) with a single 0x2B byte ("+" (U+002B) character if interpreted as ASCII). If a byte is not in the range 0x2A, 0x2D, 0x2E, 0x30 to 0x39, 0x41 to 0x5A, 0x5F, 0x61 to 0x7A, it is replaced with its hexadecimal value (zero-padded if necessary), starting with the percent sign.
member.returns: The encoded value.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet
member.summary: Bundles information stored in HTML forms.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.Boundary
member.summary: Gets the chosen boundary.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.AsMultipart(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Applies the multipart/form-data algorithm. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/forms.html#multipart/form-data-encoding-algorithm
member.returns: A stream containing the body.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.AsUrlEncoded(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Applies the urlencoded algorithm. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/forms.html#application/x-www-form-urlencoded-encoding-algorithm
member.returns: A stream containing the body.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.AsPlaintext(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Applies the plain encoding algorithm. http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/html/master/forms.html#text/plain-encoding-algorithm
member.returns: A stream containing the body.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.ReplaceCharset(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Replaces a charset field (if any) that is hidden with the given character encoding.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.CheckBoundaries(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Checks the entries for boundary collisions. If a collision is detected, then a new boundary string is generated. This algorithm will produce a boundary string that satisfies all requirements.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.Normalize(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces every occurrence of a "CR" (U+000D) character not followed by a "LF" (U+000A) character, and every occurrence of a "LF" (U+000A) character not preceded by a "CR" (U+000D) character, by a two-character string consisting of a U+000D CARRIAGE RETURN "CRLF" (U+000A) character pair.
member.returns: The normalized string.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.FormDataSetEntry
member.summary: Encapsulates the data contained in an entry.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.FormDataSetEntry.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry's name.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.FormDataSetEntry.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry's type.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.TextDataSetEntry.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry's value.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.FileDataSetEntry.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry's value.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.FormDataSet.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets an enumerator over all entry names.
member.returns: The enumerator.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Html.Entities
member.summary: Represents the list of all Html entities.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Html.Entities._strongEntities
member.summary: Strong entities always end with a semicolon.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Html.Entities._weakEntities
member.summary: Weak entities do not end with a semicolon (there are much less weak entities).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.GetSymbol(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an symbol (that ended with a semicolon) specified by its entity name.
member.param: The name of the entity, specified by &NAME; in the Html source code.
member.returns: The string with the symbol or null.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.GetSymbolWithoutSemicolon(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an symbol (that did not end with a semicolon) specified by its entity name.
member.param: The name of the entity, specified by &NAME in the Html source code.
member.returns: The string with the symbol or null.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.GetEntity(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the entity name specified by its symbol (may be ambiguous).
member.returns: The string with the entity name or null.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.Convert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a given number into its unicode character.
member.returns: The array containing the character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.Convert(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a set of two numbers into their unicode characters.
member.returns: The array containing the two characters.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.IsInvalidNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the code is an invalid number.
member.returns: True if it is an invalid number, false otherwise.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.IsInCharacterTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the given code is actually in the table of common redirections.
member.returns: True if the code is in the table, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.GetSymbolFromTable(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the symbol mapped by the table of common redirections.
member.returns: The character wrapped in a string.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Html.Entities.IsInInvalidRange(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines if the code is within an invalid range.
member.returns: True if it is within an invalid range, false otherwise.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager
member.summary: Represents the source code manager.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.#ctor
member.summary: Prepares everything.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the source code manager.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the source code manager.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.InsertionPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the insertion point.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Line
member.summary: Gets the current line within the source code.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Column
member.summary: Gets the current column within the source code.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Position
member.summary: Gets the current position within the source code.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.IsEnded
member.summary: Gets the status of reading the source code, are we beyond the stream?

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Current
member.summary: Gets the current character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.ResetInsertionPoint
member.summary: Resets the insertion point to the end of the buffer.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.SkipSpaces
member.summary: Advances to the next non-space character.
member.returns: The next non-space character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.GetNext
member.summary: Gets the next character (by advancing and returning the current character).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.GetPrevious
member.summary: Gets the previous character (by rewinding and returning the current character).
member.returns: The previous character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Advance
member.summary: Advances one character in the source code.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Advance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Advances n characters in the source code.
member.param: The number of characters to advance.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Advance(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Advances one character in the source code.
member.returns: The task to await.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Advance(System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Advances n characters in the source code.
member.param: The number of characters to advance.
member.returns: The task to await.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Back
member.summary: Moves back one character in the source code.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.Back(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves back n characters in the source code.
member.param: The number of characters to rewind.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.ContinuesWith(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Looks if the current character / next characters match a certain string.
member.param: Optional flag to set the case sensitivity.
member.returns: The status of the check.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.ContinuesWithAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Looks if the current character / next characters match a certain string.
member.param: Optional flag to set the case sensitivity.
member.returns: A task that results in the status of the check.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.AdvanceUnsafe
member.summary: Just advances one character without checking if the end is already reached.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.AdvanceUnsafeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Just advances one character without checking if the end is already reached.
member.returns: The task to await.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Parser.SourceManager.BackUnsafe
member.summary: Just goes back one character without checking if the beginning is already reached.

member.summary: Disposes all disposable objects.

member.summary: Creates a new text position.

member.summary: Gets the line within the document.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextPosition.Column
member.summary: Gets the column within the document.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextPosition.Position
member.summary: Gets the position within the source.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextPosition.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the position in the text.

member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.

member.returns: True if the given object is a text position with the same values, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextPosition.Equals(AngleSharp.TextPosition)

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextPosition.op_GreaterThan(AngleSharp.TextPosition,AngleSharp.TextPosition)

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextPosition.op_LessThan(AngleSharp.TextPosition,AngleSharp.TextPosition)
member.summary: Compares the two positions by their absolute positions in the text source.
member.returns: True if the position of the first operand is less than the second operand.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextPosition.CompareTo(AngleSharp.TextPosition)
member.summary: Compares the current position with another position.
member.returns: A mathematical representation of the relation (1 = greater, -1 = less, 0 = equal).

member.name: T:AngleSharp.TextSource
member.summary: A stream abstraction to handle encoding and more.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new text source from a string. No underlying stream will be used.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextSource.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates a new text source from a string. The underlying stream is used as an unknown data source.
member.param: The underlying stream as data source.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextSource.Text
member.summary: Gets the full text buffer.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextSource.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the character at the given position in the text buffer.
member.returns: The character.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextSource.CurrentEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the encoding to use.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextSource.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the current index of the insertation and read point.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.TextSource.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the text buffer.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextSource.ReadCharacter
member.summary: Reads the next character from the buffer or underlying stream, if any.
member.returns: The next character.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextSource.ReadCharacters(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the upcoming numbers of characters from the buffer or underlying stream, if any.

member.summary: Reads the upcoming numbers of characters from the buffer or underlying stream asynchronously.
member.param: The number of characters to read.
member.returns: The string with the next characters.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextSource.InsertText(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the given content at the current insertation mark. The insertation mark won't be changed.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.IConfiguration
member.summary: Represents the interface for a general setup of AngleSharp or a particular AngleSharp request.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.IsScripting
member.summary: Gets or sets the current scripting mode. If this is set to true, then the content of noscript tags will be skipped.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.IsStyling
member.summary: Gets or sets the current CSS mode. If this is set to true, then style-sheets will be loaded, parsed and evaluated.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.IsEmbedded
member.summary: Gets or sets the current embedding mode. Enabling embedding will emulate the document being rendered in an iframe.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.Culture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture to use.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.ScriptEngines
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the available script engines. By default no script engine is integrated.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.StyleEngines
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the available style engines, besides the default CSS engine.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.Services
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over the available services.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.Requesters
member.summary: Gets an enumeration over all available (e.g. http) requesters.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.IConfiguration.ReportError(AngleSharp.Parser.ParseErrorEventArgs)
member.summary: Method that is called once parse errors are encountered.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Current

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Active
member.summary: Gets the currently active document.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.SessionHistory
member.summary: Gets the session history of the given browsing context.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Security
member.summary: Gets the sandboxing flag of the context.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the configuration for the browsing context.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent of the current context, if any. If a parent is available, then the current context contains only embedded documents.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.Creator
member.summary: Gets the document that created the current context, if any. The creator is the active document of the parent at the time of creation.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.IBrowsingContext.NavigateTo(AngleSharp.Dom.IDocument)
member.summary: Navigates to the given document, by including it in the session history and setting it as the active document.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Network.OriginBehavior
member.summary: The default origin behaviour states.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.OriginBehavior.Taint
member.summary: Data is gathered.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.OriginBehavior.Fail
member.summary: Data is discarded in NO CORS.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames
member.summary: The collection of (known / used) header names.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.CacheControl
member.summary: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client or vice-versa whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds. e.g. Cache-Control: no-cache e.g. Cache-Control: max-age=3600

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Connection
member.summary: Options that are desired for the connection, e.g. Connection: keep-alive e.g. Connection: close

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLength
member.summary: The length of the request/response body in octets (8-bit bytes) Content-Length: 348

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentMd5
member.summary: A Base64-encoded binary MD5 sum of the content of the response, e.g. Content-MD5: Q2hlY2sgSW50ZWdyaXR5IQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentType
member.summary: The MIME type of this content (requests use this only with POST / PUT methods), e.g. Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded e.g. Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Date
member.summary: The date and time that the message was sent, e.g. Date: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 08:12:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Pragma
member.summary: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain. e.g. Pragma: no-cache

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Via
member.summary: Informs the client or server of proxies through which the response / request was sent. e.g. Via: 1.0 fred, 1.1 example.com (Apache/1.1)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Warning
member.summary: A general warning about possible problems with the entity body. e.g. Warning: 199 Miscellaneous warning

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Accept
member.summary: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response, e.g. Accept: text/plain

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptCharset
member.summary: Character sets that are acceptable, e.g. Accept-Charset: utf-8

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptEncoding
member.summary: List of acceptable encodings. See HTTP compression. e.g. Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptLanguage
member.summary: List of acceptable human languages for response, e.g. Accept-Language: en-US

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptDatetime
member.summary: Acceptable version in time, e.g. Accept-Datetime: Thu, 31 May 2007 20:35:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Authorization
member.summary: Authentication credentials for HTTP authentication, e.g. Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Cookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie previously sent by the server with Set-Cookie (below), e.g. Cookie: $Version=1; Skin=new;

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Expect
member.summary: Indicates that particular server behaviors are required by the client, e.g. Expect: 100-continue

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.From
member.summary: The email address of the user making the request, e.g. From: user@example.com

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Host
member.summary: The domain name of the server (for virtual hosting), and the TCP port number on which the server is listening. The port number may be omitted if the port is the standard port for the service requested. Mandatory since HTTP/1.1. Although domain name are specified as case-insensitive, it is not specified whether the contents of the Host field should be interpreted in a case-insensitive manner and in practice some implementations of virtual hosting interpret the contents of the Host field in a case-sensitive manner. e.g. Host: en.wikipedia.org:80

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfMatch
member.summary: Only perform the action if the client supplied entity matches the same entity on the server. This is mainly for methods like PUT to only update a resource if it has not been modified since the user last updated it. e.g. If-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfModifiedSince
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, e.g. If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: Allows a 304 Not Modified to be returned if content is unchanged, see HTTP ETag, e.g. If-None-Match: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfRange
member.summary: If the entity is unchanged, send me the part(s) that I am missing; otherwise, send me the entire new entity. e.g. If-Range: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.IfUnmodifiedSince
member.summary: Only send the response if the entity has not been modified since a specific time, e.g. If-Unmodified-Since: Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.MaxForwards
member.summary: Limit the number of times the message can be forwarded through proxies or gateways, e.g. Max-Forwards: 10

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Origin
member.summary: Initiates a request for cross-origin resource sharing (asks server for an 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' response header), e.g. Origin: http://www.example-social-network.com

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthorization
member.summary: Authorization credentials for connecting to a proxy, e.g. Proxy-Authorization: Basic QWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuIHNlc2FtZQ==

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Range
member.summary: Request only part of an entity. Bytes are numbered from 0. e.g. Range: bytes=500-999

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Referer
member.summary: This is the address of the previous web page from which a link to the currently requested page was followed. (The word referrer is misspelled in the RFC as well as in most implementations.), e.g. Referer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Te
member.summary: The transfer encodings the user agent is willing to accept: the same values as for the response header Transfer-Encoding can be used, plus the "trailers" value (related to the "chunked" transfer method) to notify the server it expects to receive additional headers (the trailers) after the last, zero-sized, chunk. e.g. TE: trailers, deflate

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Upgrade
member.summary: Ask the server to upgrade to another protocol. e.g. Upgrade: HTTP/2.0, SHTTP/1.3, IRC/6.9, RTA/x11

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.UserAgent
member.summary: The user agent string of the user agent, e.g. User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AccessControlAllowOrigin
member.summary: Specifying which web sites can participate in cross-origin resource sharing, e.g. Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.AcceptRanges
member.summary: What partial content range types this server supports, e.g. Accept-Ranges: bytes

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Age
member.summary: The age the object has been in a proxy cache in seconds, e.g. Age: 12

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Allow
member.summary: Valid actions for a specified resource. To be used for a 405 Method not allowed. e.g. Allow: GET, HEAD

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The type of encoding used on the data. See HTTP compression. e.g. Content-Encoding: gzip

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLanguage
member.summary: The language the content is in, e.g. Content-Language: da

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentLocation
member.summary: An alternate location for the returned data Content-Location: /index.htm

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentDisposition
member.summary: An opportunity to raise a "File Download" dialogue box for a known MIME type with binary format or suggest a filename for dynamic content. Quotes are necessary with special characters. e.g. Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fname.ext"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ContentRange
member.summary: Where in a full body message this partial message belongs, e.g. Content-Range: bytes 21010-47021/47022

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ETag
member.summary: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest, e.g. ETag: "737060cd8c284d8af7ad3082f209582d"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Expires
member.summary: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale, e.g. Expires: Thu, 01 Dec 1994 16:00:00 GMT

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.LastModified
member.summary: The last modified date for the requested object, in RFC 2822 format e.g. Last-Modified: Tue, 15 Nov 1994 12:45:26 +0000

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Link
member.summary: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC 5988 e.g. Link: </feed>; rel="alternate"

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Location
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created. e.g. Location: http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.P3p
member.summary: This header is supposed to set P3P policy, in the form of P3P:CP="your_compact_policy". However, P3P did not take off, most browsers have never fully implemented it, a lot of websites set this header with fake policy text, that was enough to fool browsers the existence of P3P policy and grant permissions for third party cookies. e.g. P3P: CP="This is not a P3P policy! See ... for more info."

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.ProxyAuthenticate
member.summary: Request authentication to access the proxy. e.g. Proxy-Authenticate: Basic

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Refresh
member.summary: Used in redirection, or when a new resource has been created. This refresh redirects after 5 seconds. e.g. Refresh: 5; url=http://www.w3.org/pub/WWW/People.html

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.RetryAfter
member.summary: If an entity is temporarily unavailable, this instructs the client to try again after a specified period of time (seconds). e.g. Retry-After: 120

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Server
member.summary: A name for the server, e.g. Server: Apache/2.4.1 (Unix)

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.SetCookie
member.summary: An HTTP cookie, e.g. Set-Cookie: UserID=JohnDoe; Max-Age=3600; Version=1

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Status
member.summary: The HTTP status of the response. "Status" is not listed as a registered header. The "Status-Line" of a "Response" is defined by RFC2616 without any explicit Status: header name. e.g. Status: 200 OK

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.StrictTransportSecurity
member.summary: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains. e.g. Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=16070400; includeSubDomains

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Trailer
member.summary: The Trailer general field value indicates that the given set of header fields is present in the trailer of a message encoded with chunked transfer-coding. e.g. Trailer: Max-Forwards

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.TransferEncoding
member.summary: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity. e.g. Transfer-Encoding: chunked

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.Vary
member.summary: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server. e.g. Vary: *

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Network.HeaderNames.WwwAuthenticate
member.summary: Indicates the authentication scheme that should be used to access the requested entity. e.g. WWW-Authenticate: Basic

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Network.DefaultRequest
member.summary: The default HTTP request encapsulation type.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Network.DefaultRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new default requests.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DefaultRequest.Method
member.summary: Gets or sets the method that should be used.

member.name: P:AngleSharp.Network.DefaultRequest.Address

member.name: T:AngleSharp.TextEncoding
member.summary: Various HTML encoding helpers.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Utf8
member.summary: Gets the UTF-8 encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Utf16Be
member.summary: Gets the UTF-16 (Big Endian) encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Utf16Le
member.summary: Gets the UTF-16 (Little Endian) encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Utf32Le
member.summary: Gets the UTF-32 (Little Endian) encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Utf32Be
member.summary: Gets the UTF-32 (Little Endian) encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Gb18030
member.summary: Gets the chinese government standard encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Big5
member.summary: Gets the Big5 encoding.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Windows1252
member.summary: Gets the Windows-1252 encoding.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.IsUnicode(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Checks if the provided encoding is any UTF-16 encoding.
member.returns: The result of the check (UTF-16BE, UTF-16LE).

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to extract the encoding from the given http-equiv content string.
member.returns: The extracted encoding or null if the encoding is invalid.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.IsSupported(System.String)
member.summary: Detects if a valid encoding has been found in the given charset string.
member.returns: True if a valid encdoing has been found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves an Encoding instance given by the charset string. If the desired encoding is not found (or supported), then UTF-8 will be returned.
member.returns: An instance of the Encoding class or null.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.Suggest(System.String)
member.summary: Suggests an Encoding for the given local.
member.param: The local defined by the BCP 47 language tag.
member.returns: The suggested encoding.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.TextEncoding.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the encoding for lesser used charsets. This might result in an exception depending on the platform (mostly Windows Phone *). Exceptions are handled by returning UTF8. That should work well in most scenarios.
member.returns: The encoding for the given charset.
